title: How is it fair?
body:
That tanks like Shyv, Mundo, Garen etc etc do so much damage?

everyone needs a trade off, Braum is tanky, so he doesn't have damage.

Vlad is part mage part tank, he has a fair ammount of damage (but nothing close to Lux or syndra) and a fair amount of tankiness, (but nothing compared to taric and leona.)

Anivia deals tons of damage, but isn't tanky at all.

so how is it fair that these champs are so hard to kill AND do so much fucking damage??

replies.body: There is a very real tradeoff, which you seem to have missed completely, and its that they have very poor cc. These types of tanks are useful precisely because they are a damage threat whilst being hard to kill. Other tanks, like braum, or nautilus or alistar etc are useful because they are hard to kill and repeatedly cc people during a fight. Add to that the fact their only gap closers are movespeed boosts (apart from shyv ult) which makes them very susceptible to getting kited, and you can hardly say they have no tradeoffs. If someone like braum had comparible damage there would be no reason to ever play those 3.

It's fair because they are easy to kite. As long as you have a half competent support, he should be able to get these guys off you, provided they aren't super fed.

The real problem is Zed, Rengar, LeBlanc and Talon. As a support main those are the hardest to peel. Garen is just a hook and focus, and Shyvanna's only dash has a huge wind-up time and can be interrupted. 

Mundo is OP ATM, but back in the day it was so easy to kite him. He tends to leave lane ahead or fed right now, so he needs a bit more teamwork to deal with him usually.

Theres your problem ^

plus in what world is Mundo easy to kite?? its not like he has a +10000000 move speed ult or a Q that basically snares you. every few seconds.

For those of us not willing to just hyperbole, it's a fairly easy to dodge skillshot, and an ult that is still fairly easy to kite out unless your totally immobile in the first place, and the immobility is more the problem then anything if that's the case.

You can't complain about inability to kite if you go immobile champs in solo Q.

Firstly. Most ADC's are fairly Immobile, along with a huge chunk of the mages as well, so theres a shitload of champs that shouldn't be used in solo Q according to you.

Secondly. Mundo has 345 base movement speed, most ADC's have 325, so Mundo already starts 20 ahead of them (which means even with boots he will always be 20 ahead, unless he buys speed boots in which case it will be even more), His Q has a 3 second cooldown with CDR, and slows them by 40%, that reduces their move speed to 195 for 2 seconds, meanwhile his own movement speed is increased to 466 for 12 seconds. Thats a 141 faster ms than the adc for 1 second and then 271 difference for 2 seconds and that continues for 12 seconds. 

Now let us allow for dashes,
With his ult, Mundo will cover 5592 units over the duration
Corki (as an example) will cover, 3900
But Corki has a 600 unit dash, it takes approximately 0.25 seconds to complete, which brings his total distance covered to 4419 units.
which means Mundo still catches up to him way before the duration ends. (and this is without even using his Q) 

Now what about Kiting,
lets use Ashe for this example because she is known as the kiting queen.
say our Ashe has a 1.00 AS meaning she releases 1 arrow every second. and her arrows slow the target for 2 seconds (decaying over the duration) She slows Mundo by 50% on every attack except her first which slows by 25%, but by the time the next arrow hits the slow has decreased to 25% (13% on the first arrow) 
in order to simplify the maths we will say that half of the 1 second, Mundo is slowed by 50% and half he is slowed by 25% (this simplification doesn't make any difference to the final result, but it makes the maths much easier to see) 
so the 5592 units he would cover must be broken up into halves, one half is slowed by 50% and the other half is slowed by 25% 
2798 is half of 5592 and 2798 slowed by 50% is 1398, and 2798 slowed by 25% is 2097 which means his total distance covered is now 3495 units, however we need to account for her first attack slowing by half as much, which brings Mundo's units covered to a total of 3673. But Ashe cant shoot an arrow and run at the same time, she needs to stand still for the first half of her attack animation (the windup) which means she needs to stand still for 0.5 seconds per arrow, which means she is running half the time and standing still half the time, which means over the 12 seconds her units travelled is halved from 3900 to 1950.
which means Mundo STILL catches up to her wayyy before the duration ends.
(and again this is without landing even a single mundo Q)

So in other words:
'fairly easy to kite' my ass!

Yep let's use corki as an example but make him brain dead and not go over a wall.

And ashe as an example and not have her use her ult.

And lets assume all of them are 1v1 against this mundo cause sense.

There are no walls in the middle of a lane. say he's pushed between the first bot red turret and the first blue one, what wall is he supposed to go over?

if ults were always up what a wonderful world we would live in, in any case her ult would stun him for 1 second at that close range, which would remove 466 units from his 3673 bringing it to 3207 which means he will STILL catch her. Your point?

sometimes your team isn't there and you didnt expect Mundo to be, if no one was ever out of position there would be no deaths ever?

if mundo was so easy to get rid of he wouldnt have a 53% win rate.
So in other words, your bitching cause you always get caught out.

who said anything about 'always'?
i get caught out just like everyone else, not always though.
and if you say you don't ever get caught out then your a liar.
and that has nothing to do with this post.

what I'm bitching about is that Garen, Shyv, Mundo etc. etc. do too much damage for the amount of tankiness they have.

you were the one that said Mundo is easy to kite and i just proved that you're wrong. its that simple.

The Q is really only a problem if you're out of position, it should hit the front line not you. His movement speed on ultimate shouldn't matter much, if you have a decent round of stuns. This is all assuming that Dr. Mundo is ahead, if he's behind he'll probably just get ignited and die 1v5.

A lot of players in solo queue seem to have this kiting issue, but if you have good positioning you wont really need to kite.
Its not fair this is league of legends if your not a legend then too bad your not allowed to have fun
Welcome to the league of tanks.

I feel this on so many levels. I guess the trade off is that they don't really offer anything else to the team, which in some cases, against certain comps, is actually fine, since those three champions you specifically mentioned can be kited out very easily and can be rendered useless, but then you've got your Tahms and your Malphites and goddamn it's frustrating
